segments.text: Aunt Shirley , I heard the Yuan Miao Festival is the name for the festival . Why did it get its name ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , the first lunar month is called Yuan-month , and in ancient times people called night Miao . And you know the festival is just in the middle of the month .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , I see . I also heard today is the last day for the street fair . Can ’ t wait to sample all the snacks .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . It ’ s indeed a culinary heaven which offers a wide range of delicious snacks to satisfy all tastes . Then , which one would you like ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: OK . Let ’ s go over there . For the Lantern Festival , you should never omit the Yuanxiao .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: What ’ s that ? It gets the name from the festival itself . That ’ s really funny !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Actually , they are small dumpling balls made of glutinous rice flour . They are like Tangun .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Oh , I know Tangyuan . It ’ s a sweet snack , good for dessert .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes . And also , we can find Yuanxiao with both sweet and salty fillings .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ d like to try the salty ones . Where does that strange smell come from ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh , the smelly bean curd . My favorite !
segments.speaker: S2
